creator: mr108

title: CCTV systems with Network Video Recorder (NVR) over cat6a PoE
content:
Hi,

I have been designing a Hikvision CCTV system and bumped into a problem. Mac users cannot use a browser to access all the various controls and settings as Hikvision rely upon ActiveX, which is old and a security risk. I am informed that this problem exists in the whole CCTV industry! I am advised that Hikvision will eventually dump ActiveX in favour of HTML5, but this seems to require a new operating system!

I think it's incredible that a whole industry should build itself upon one piece of legacy. Surely browsers would be the way to go. That way online acccess to a CCTV system would be OS independent. Does onyone have some thoughts on this?

Why not implement an HTML5 plugin?

I'm no expert, but have been around computer tech since the early 1980s.

Comments/observations much appreciated.

Regards Michael
creator: info1130

title: Firefox Font Problems
content:
Hello, I've had the problem for a while now, and finally decided to do something about it. When I am visiting certain websites the fonts for the headlines are all messed up. I attached two images of the official website of berlin, one opened with firefox, one opened with safari. You can see that the font problem is primarily applying to headlines. Since this doesn't happen on every website, I was thinking this could be due to firefox not being able to handle one certain font. You will also notice, that firefox doesn't display german letters such as ä, ö and ü.

I have already tried playing around with the performance settings, and my language is set to german. I am thankful for every new idea.

Cheers

Tom

title: Add-on ID/URL changes everytime I install
content:
The add-on in question is FlowCrypt (flowcrypt.com). We need to have a stable, predictable origin to enable in CORS, but the add-on ID changes upon every install. Is there a way for an add-on to have a stable ID/origin? How is this accomplished?

We are using the addons.mozilla.com self-publish mechanism, where I'm having Mozilla sign each release, but then we are self-hosting a json file at https://flowcrypt.com/api/update/firefox the individual xpi fles.

Thanks a ton!

title: Firefox can't find CDC.gov site. Works fine in Safari
content:

So I tried Safari (14.0.1), and cdc.gov loads immediately with no problems.

What the heck?

title: Suppress auto printing
content: Apparently it is possible to write a web page such that it pops up the printer dialogue on load. That is, something in the page automatically launches the print dialogue. Usually that is wanted/expected behavior. For example, you just clicked on a "Print" button on the page. In my case, there is one page I use a lot that tries to auto-print a PDF. But I have PDF's set to open outside of FireFox. So the PDF loads in Acrobat (expected behavior), and FireFox tries to print the HTML page that is open in FireFox. Also presumably expected behavior, but not wanted if it is the PDF I want to print. This has gotten annoying, and so I'm looking for a control that suppresses printing. Ten minutes of googleing and all I can find are articles for the control to suppress the dialogue for printing, and instead print directly to the default printer, ie silent printing. I don't want to suppress the dialog. I want to auto-cancel the print job. That is, I want to disallow a web page from invoking the print dialog at all, by overriding the print instruction. Such as setting could either be set for a specific page, set or globally; either would work for me. Is there a control for that?

title: Al cerrar el navegador o la página web, Firefox me cierra sesión automáticamente ¿cómo puedo evitar esto?
content: Hola Esto es muy raro y no pasaba antes. Si tengo abierto el Facebook y estoy logueado, puedo navegar sin problemas, pero al cerrar la pestaña o cerrar el navegador, si Facebook se cierra al abrirlo otra vez me pide la contraseña de acceso, es decir, me cierra la sesión automáticamente sin haberla cerrado yo. Esto me pasa con Facebook, Twitter, Instagram y con Linkedin. Es muy molesto tener que ir logueandome cada vez que cierro una pestaña, es más, me pasa hasta con Google, porque algunas veces al cerrar la pestaña de Google, si vuelvo a entrar en Google me pide otra vez que acepte los términos de acuerdo de Google. ¿Cómo puedo evitar esto, es la primera vez que me pasa una cosa así desde que uso Firefox? Saludos
creator: mrmister23
